title: Mastering React Hooks in 2025
author: Ava Mitchell
excerpt: React Hooks have transformed how developers build components. Learn how to use them efficiently in 2025.
content: React Hooks simplify state and lifecycle management. With new hooks like useTransition and useDeferredValue, developers can handle complex UI updates with ease.

title: A Beginner’s Guide to RESTful APIs
author: Noah Carter
excerpt: REST APIs power most of the modern web. Here’s how to build your first one with Node.js and Express.
content: APIs allow communication between frontend and backend. Using Express, we can easily create routes, handle requests, and respond with JSON.

title: The Art of Writing Clean JavaScript Code
author: Liam Rodriguez
excerpt: Writing clean code isn’t just about style—it’s about maintainability, scalability, and teamwork.
content: Use meaningful variable names, modularize your code, and prefer pure functions. Linting tools like ESLint can also enforce consistency.

title: UI/UX Trends to Watch in 2025
author: Sophia Brown
excerpt: 2025 brings fresh design principles—bold typography, immersive interactions, and minimalist aesthetics.
content: Micro-interactions and accessibility are top priorities. Designers now focus more on inclusivity and motion design to enhance user experiences.

title: Exploring Next.js 15 New Features
author: Ethan Walker
excerpt: Next.js 15 introduces faster builds, improved caching, and native image optimization. Let’s explore what’s new.
content: Next.js continues to push the boundaries of React-based SSR and static generation. New routing APIs and improved performance make it even better for production apps.

title: Why TypeScript Is Taking Over JavaScript
author: Olivia Kim
excerpt: TypeScript is now a must-have skill for frontend and backend developers alike. Here’s why.
content: TypeScript offers static type checking, better tooling, and fewer runtime errors. It improves developer productivity and application reliability.
